review: Perhaps it was just me not researching properly but I assumed that with the Amazon Prime membership there would be a much larger selection of more recent content available for streaming. Several TV shows I follow are only available for streaming via Prime for season 1 and they are currently going on seasons 3 to 6. Movies available for Prime streaming seem to be a number of years old in many cases. Again it was my mistake for not researching properly.I really like the idea of having everything available to me through one provider (ie: Amazon, kindle). Their products and shopping services in my opinion are fantastic. The implementation of accessibility to features and content seems to be extremely lacking. I hope that some consideration will be made to make Amazon Fire TV worth it when maintaining an Amazon prime membership.
author: Robert Vogel

review: I've only had Amazon Fire TV 3 weeks so the jury is still out.  Some initial observations: 1. The selection of free Amazon Prime movies/TV shows (videos) is fairly limited, maybe 150 - 200 total.  Since this covers all genres, not a whole lot I am interested in.  2.  The rest you pay to watch and add to your library.  3.  The total AF library is huge.  I found an obscure Italian film from 1963, but it still costs around $4 to watch.  4.  The AF box won't turn off.  It's supposed to be automatic,  but stayed on all night.  The box gets very hot.  5. Watching is a joy.  Seamless movement thru spaces where commercial s would have been.  High quality HD.  We watched 4 seasons of Falling Skies in about a week, watching 3 - 5 episodes a night.  6. I am not a gamer, but if you are, get the game controller.  7.  AF TV may have more utility in the future.  For now, it's a nice expansion of viewable programs.  Works great  with my 2003 Sony Bravia TV and home wifi. With the HDMI cable sold separately.
